name: unscarred
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of skin) without a scar (= a mark left after an injury has healed) on it: The skin is then replaced with unscarred skin. The light struck the unscarred side of his face.
without any damage to a person's mental or emotional health, or not showing any damage of this kind: They have both experienced a great deal, and both have emerged not quite unscarred, but with their spirit intact. He looked unscarred by his difficult childhood.
(of a place) without any signs of physical destruction: The pictures present a world in which animals roam free in landscapes that are peaceful and unscarred. This was a city relatively unscarred by war.
